title.narrative: PROTECTION OP5 - CHILD PROTECTION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Child Protection services are available to vulnerable populations in emergency situations., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable prevention of and response to exploitation of and violence against children in targeted provinces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child Protection services are available to vulnerable populations in emergency situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF coordinated inputs on child protection in in the work of the Protection Cluster. However, the child protection area of responsibility as a separate entity was not active and needs to be revitalized. UNICEF initiated a rapid assessment of the protection-related impacts of the drought in the South, covering both child protection and GBV. UNICEF advocated for inclusion of child protection and psycho-social support in national COVID-19 response plans and supported the capacity building and provision of protective equipment to para social workers to enable them to provide psycho-social support to children and families affected by the epidemic. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:13/01/2021
